title: {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}} docs
introduction: Explore the capabilities of {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}}. You can get started with deploying platform services by using {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} workspaces, and automating cloud operations with {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} actions. Learn more about how {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} works and the benefits of using the service.

section_recommended.title: Deploy cloud services with workspaces
section_recommended.description: Use an IBM-provided Terraform template to create an {{site.data.keyword.cos_short}} service instance to persistently store your data in {{site.data.keyword.cloud_notm}}.

section_recommended.title: Automate cloud operations with actions
section_recommended.description: Learn how to automatically start and stop a {{site.data.keyword.vsi_is_short}} instance with an IBM-provided Ansible playbook.

section_recommended.title: Learn more about {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}}
section_recommended.description: Learn about how {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} works, integrated open source technologies, and the benefits of using the service.

tiles.title: Ansible support in {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}} is now generally available
tiles.description: Use {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} Actions to run your Ansible playbooks in {{site.data.keyword.cloud_notm}}, and automate the configuration, operation, and management of cloud resources, or deploy multi-tier app workloads. To get started, see the [{{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} landing page](/docs/schematics?topic=schematics-getting-started), try out one of the [IBM-provided Ansible playbooks](/docs/schematics?topic=schematics-sample_actiontemplates) or learn more about how {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} integrates Ansible in [About {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}}](/docs/schematics?topic=schematics-about-schematics#how-to-actions).

tiles.title: Terraform v0.14 support
tiles.description: {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}} now supports Terraform v0.14. You can now select to run your infrastructure code with Terraform version 0.11 or 0.12 or 0.13 or 0.14. Make sure that you use the syntax that is compatible with the Terraform version that you want to use.

tiles.title: {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}} supports the ability to persist user-defined files
tiles.description: {{site.data.keyword.bplong_notm}} now supports the ability to persist user-defined files for running subsequent Terraform commands. For more information, see [persist user-defined files in {{site.data.keyword.bpshort}}](/docs/schematics?topic=schematics-faqs#persist-file).
